unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Interest Across India**
normalised: Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Interest Across India

unnormalised: Good news for all you eco-conscious Indians! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is continuing its solar rooftop subsidy program, and folks are lining up for it like it's free jalebi.
normalised: Good news for all you eco-conscious Indians! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is continuing its solar rooftop subsidy program, and folks are lining up for it like it is free jalebi.

unnormalised: The scheme offers subsidies up to 40% for residential rooftops, making solar power way more affordable. Think cheaper electricity bills and reduced carbon footprint – win-win!
normalised: The scheme offers subsidies up to forty percent for residential rooftops, making solar power way more affordable. Think cheaper electricity bills and reduced carbon footprint – win-win!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIT-Delhi mentioned that the biggest demand is coming from states like Gujarat and Rajasthan, where the sun shines brighter than your average Diwali diya.
normalised: Doctor Sharma from I I T-Delhi mentioned that the biggest demand is coming from states like Gujarat and Rajasthan, where the sun shines brighter than your average Diwali diya.

unnormalised: Reports suggest a family installing a 3kW system on a 300 sq ft rooftop could save upwards of Rs. 30,000 a year. That's enough for a nice family vacation to Goa, right?
normalised: Reports suggest a family installing a three kilowatt system on a three hundred square feet rooftop could save upwards of rupees thirty thousand a year. That is enough for a nice family vacation to Goa, right?

unnormalised: But be warned! There are reports of middlemen trying to scam people. Always go through authorized vendors. Don't be a bakra! Check the MNRE website for approved installers.
normalised: But be warned! There are reports of middlemen trying to scam people. Always go through authorized vendors. Do not be a bakra! Check the M N R E website for approved installers.

unnormalised: The program aims to add 40 GW of rooftop solar capacity by 2026. Let's make Bharat shine, one solar panel at a time! Apply soon, subsidies are first come, first served! The application process is reportedly simple, like online shopping, but maybe less addictive.
normalised: The program aims to add forty gigawatt of rooftop solar capacity by two thousand and twenty six. Let us make Bharat shine, one solar panel at a time! Apply soon, subsidies are first come, first served! The application process is reportedly simple, like online shopping, but maybe less addictive.
